Name: Situla
Description: This small situla has a pointed base, the handle is missing. The exterior is worked in relief. The base is depicted as a lotus flower with fine petals. Above there are two registers with representations. In the wider register, someone is shown offering in front of an altar and the god Min, a cat-headed goddess, a god with the head of an animal and Nephthys. The narrower register depicts the god Heh and the solar bark twice. Underneath the rim is a row of hieroglyphs.
